title: Faron Anderson
text:
Faron Anderson (born 14 February 1975) is an Australian former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1990s. Primarily a er, he was a foundation player for the <a href="North%20Queensland%20Cowboys">North Queensland Cowboys</a>.
Playing career.
In Round 15 of the <a href="1995%20ARL%20season">1995 ARL season</a>, Anderson made his first grade debut in the Cowboys' first ever home win, a 31-12 victory over the <a href="Western%20Suburbs%20Magpies">Western Suburbs Magpies</a>. He would play just three games over two seasons for the club.
In 1998, Anderson joined the <a href="Burleigh%20Bears">Burleigh Bears</a> in the <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a>. In 1999, he started on the wing in their <a href="1999%20Queensland%20Cup">Grand Final</a> win over the <a href="Redcliffe%20Dolphins">Redcliffe Dolphins</a>. 
In 2001, Anderson moved to the <a href="Ipswich%20Jets">Ipswich Jets</a> and started at centre in their <a href="2002%20Queensland%20Cup">2002 Grand Final</a> loss to the <a href="Redcliffe%20Dolphins">Redcliffe Dolphins</a>. In 2003, he returned to Burleigh, coming off the bench in their <a href="2003%20Queensland%20Cup">Grand Final</a> loss to Redcliffe.
